OpenAI Retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1 Models

OpenAI retiring GPT-4o, GPT-4.1, GPT-4.1 mini, and o4-mini from ChatGPT on February 13th, 2026. Consolidation toward newer models.

Apple Partners with Google for Gemini-Powered Siri

Apple launching Gemini AI-powered Siri in February 2026 with iOS 26.4. Major shift in Apple's AI strategy, leveraging Google's model for more intelligent, context-aware voice assistant.

Saturday, January 31, 2026

ModelCometAPI

OpenAI GPT-5.3 'Garlic' Enters Final Validation

GPT-5.3 'Garlic' is in final internal validation stages. Codenamed after Sam Altman's December 2025 'Code Red', it represents a strategic shift toward 'cognitive density' over raw scale. Designed for higher reasoning performance and inference efficiency rather than larger parameter counts. Response to Google Gemini 3 and Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 competition.

Friday, January 30, 2026

MarketWikipedia/Anthropic

Anthropic-Google Cloud Partnership: 1 Million TPUs by 2026

Anthropic announced cloud partnership with Google, gaining access to up to one million custom TPUs. Partnership will bring more than one gigawatt of AI compute capacity online by 2026.

ResearchNDTV

Anthropic CEO Warns: AI Could Be Misused for Biological Weapons

Dario Amodei warned AI may soon be 'better than humans at almost everything.' The comments highlight growing concerns about frontier AI safety and potential misuse.

MarketForward Future / TechCrunch

Tesla Invests $2B in xAI

Tesla invested $2 billion in Elon Musk's AI startup xAI as part of a broader $20 billion funding round. The transaction formalizes a symbiotic intelligence layer, embedding Grok's reasoning into Tesla's physical hardware. Marks a deeper shift toward AI and robotics as Tesla faces falling EV sales.

ModelForward Future / TechCrunch

Arcee Unveils 400B Open LLM Trinity

Tiny startup Arcee AI released Trinity 400B, a sparse Mixture-of-Experts model activating 13B parameters, built from scratch for $20M. Apache-licensed model aims to rival Meta's Llama 4 Maverick on coding, math, and reasoning benchmarks. Trained in six months, targeting developers seeking a permanently open U.S.-based alternative.

ProductForward Future / TechCrunch

Moltbot (Clawdbot) Goes Viral

Personal AI assistant Moltbot (formerly Clawdbot) went viral after promising to 'actually do things.' Built by Austrian developer Peter Steinberger, the open-source project attracted 44,200 GitHub stars within weeks. Anthropic legal challenge forced name change. Cloudflare stock rose 14% premarket on buzz. Experts warn security risks.

ProductForward Future / TechCrunch

Google Chrome Adds Agentic AI Features

Google is rolling out deeper Gemini integration in Chrome with a persistent AI sidebar and early agentic features. The assistant can understand groups of tabs, answer questions about browsing context, and integrates 'Personal Intelligence' to synthesize Gmail, Calendar, and Photos data for autonomous task execution.

MarketForward Future / CNN

Amazon Cuts 16,000 Jobs Amid AI Push

Amazon announced fresh layoffs to reduce bureaucracy as it competes with Microsoft and Google in AI. About 9% of staff trimmed. The cuts come as the company accelerates AI investment.

MarketForward Future / Seeking Alpha

Waabi Raises $1B for Robotaxis

Autonomous trucking startup Waabi closed a $1 billion Series C to expand into robotaxis, intensifying competition in self-driving mobility.

ResearchForward Future

Robots Can Now See Through Glass

Researchers tested LingBot-Depth, an AI depth system helping robots handle reflective and transparent objects where normal cameras fail. Success rates jumped sharply in real-world trials. The system worked in mirror-filled gyms and glass lobbies using cheap consumer cameras, making previously impossible tasks achievable.

MarketAI Weekly

Microsoft Crashes 12% on AI CapEx Concerns

Microsoft shares suffered worst drop since 2020 after reporting $37.5B quarterly AI CapEx (up 66% YoY) while Azure growth slowed to 39%. The market is punishing 'blind spending' on AI infrastructure, triggering sector-wide sell-off. Analysts point to 'DeepSeek Shock' as root cause - efficient Chinese models making $100B+ data center build-outs look like over-provisioning.

ResearchReuters

Nvidia Under US Scrutiny for Allegedly Helping DeepSeek

Reports confirm Nvidia is under fresh US scrutiny for 'supporting' Chinese AI efficiency. According to NVIDIA records, Nvidia personnel helped DeepSeek achieve major training efficiency gains through 'optimized co-design of algorithms, frameworks, and hardware.' DeepSeek-V3 requires only 2.788M H800 GPU hours for full training - less than what U.S. developers typically require for frontier-scale models.

ResearchMarketScreener

Pentagon Clashes with Anthropic Over Military AI Safeguards

The Pentagon is at odds with Anthropic over safeguards that would prevent the government from deploying its technology to target weapons autonomously. The dispute highlights growing tensions between AI companies and military applications.

Anthropic CEO Warns: 'The Adolescence of Technology'

Dario Amodei publishes 19,000-word essay warning humanity is entering a 'rite of passage' that will 'test who we are as a species'. States powerful AI systems could be 1-2 years away and the world is 'considerably closer to real danger' than in 2023.

MCP sees rapid uptake by OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and toolmakers like Zed and Sourcegraph. Protocol addresses growing demand for contextually-aware AI agents capable of pulling from diverse sources.

Anthropic Internal Conflict: Safety vs Speed

The Atlantic reports on tensions within Anthropic between safety researchers and pressure to ship products faster. Safety researcher Sam Bowman: 'Things are moving uncomfortably fast.'

Thursday, December 25, 2025

ModelPromptitude

Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Sonnet 4.5 Launch

Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Sonnet 4.5, introducing advanced reasoning with focus on ethical AI and robust safety measures. Opus 4.5 excels in multi-step reasoning, real-world coding, and agent-based tasks. Sonnet 4.5 optimized for complex B2B workflows with enhanced coding capabilities and multi-file reasoning.

Friday, December 12, 2025

ModelPromptitude

Google Gemini 3 Pro Released

Google released Gemini 3 Pro with remarkable speed and multimodal features ideal for coding, rapid Q&A, and generating mixed content types. The model shows strong improvements in pretraining and post-training, achieving 53.3% on OpenAI's GDPval benchmark.

Thursday, December 11, 2025

ModelFortune

OpenAI Releases GPT-5.2

OpenAI launched GPT-5.2 (codenamed 'Garlic'), showing major performance improvements over GPT-5. The model achieved 70.9% on GDPval benchmark vs GPT-5's 38.8%, and 55.6% on SWE-Bench Pro coding benchmark. Released after Sam Altman issued 'code red' to focus resources on core product improvements.

Thursday, December 4, 2025

ModelVellum.ai / RDWorld

Google Gemini 3 Deep Think Released

Google announced Gemini 3 Deep Think rolling out to Ultra subscribers. The Deep Think variant achieves 40%+ on Humanity's Last Exam benchmark, designed to challenge frontier AI systems. Combined with standard Gemini 3 Pro achieving 91.9% on GPQA Diamond, marking state-of-the-art reasoning performance.
